intro: Nemastylis punctata, commonly known as the spotted nemastylis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, compound leaves with a distinctive spotted pattern on the underside. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
